Printing

  • To know the printer names attached to your computer: 
    lpstat -v
  • To make one of the printers the default one: 
    lpoptions -d <printer_name>

    (sometimes this step is necessary)

  • For printing files, use the syntax: 
    lpr -P <printer_name> <filename>

    the output will be of the format: device for <printer_name>: <device>

  • Printing to PDF: 
     	lpstat -P Print_to_PDF filename

    (Here, by default, the printer name is Print_to_PDF) (Note: Sometimes, it produces blank pages i.e. does not print anything. In that case, delete the printer from Menu> Printing and add a generic cpus:/ printer with the name Print_to_PDF (If you want to use that name at all))

This project is maintained by debdeepbh
